caption: This photograph features an elderly man standing next to a vintage gasoline pump at a service station. He is wearing dark-rimmed glasses, a dark T-shirt, and dark pants, with his hands casually placed on the gas pump. The pump is adorned with signs that display "Gulf No-nox" logos and a prominent hand-written cardboard sign on its top stating "Sorry No GAS", indicating a shortage. Behind the man, the station's signage reads "STAY HAPPY WITH LAFFIN GAS", possibly a clever name or slogan for the establishment. The background show parts of the station, including a red-striped awning, and suggests a sunny day with bright lighting conditions. The setting provides a glimpse into a mid 20th-century American gas station.
title: 'Sign of the energy crisis'
